input_text:
Job Title: Food Science, Quality, and Safety Intern

Location: Greater Boston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Who We Are

ButcherBox is a fast-paced, rapidly-growing company headquartered in Watertown, MA. At ButcherBox, we believe in better. That’s why we deliver 100% grass-fed, grass-finished beef, free-range organic chicken, pork raised crate-free, and wild-caught seafood directly to our members’ doors. All of our products are humanely raised or wild-caught and never given antibiotics or added hormones ever.

We’re working to build a world that’s better for all, and we’re inviting everyone to come along. For us, better means treating our planet with respect. It means improving the lives of animals and the livelihoods of farmers. It means never cutting corners when it comes to doing business. Ultimately, it means better meals, enjoyed together. Our team is made up of people who collaborate and support one another. We’re always looking for outstanding people to join our mission!

 About The Role 

As an intern with ButcherBox Food Science, Quality, and Safety (FSQS), you will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience and contribute to meaningful projects. This role offers hands-on learning opportunities in a supportive and collaborative environment.

Responsibilities

Assist the team with various tasks including research, data analysis, and project coordinationContribute creative ideas and suggestions to improve processesAnalyze data and report on supplier performance, identifying trends, and areas for improvementAssist in maintaining and updating company and department policies, procedures, and other relevant documentationAssist in developing and implementing quality control procedures to ensure adherence to food safety regulations and company standardsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot product/supplier issues and recommend solutionsCollaborate with other team members to ensure timely completion of projects

Responsibilities

Interest in Food Science/Nutrition/Agriculture disciplinesStrong comfort level in Microsoft Office suite including Teams and SharepointStrong attention to detailFamiliarity with Jira, Optiva/M3 and other software systems a big plusHybrid schedule: must be able to commute to our Watertown, MA office at least 1 day per week

What We Offer

Compensation: $21/hourFood: a free Custom Classic ButcherBox each month and weekly lunch reimbursementResume writing and job search coaching

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure all individuals are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
